reviews.text: I did go in july of 2012,so maybe this hotel is better on a more occupied month.First ,ride from airport to hotel is 1hr 30 very bumpy ride.Rooms are old ,mold on walls,they tried to patch up with paint,door and patio has a 2 inch gap,when it rains water gets in room and also insects.shingles on roof on hotel are broken and nevered maintained ,lots of water leeks to corridor and into rooms.(this is july,rainy season).Same food was repassed up to 4 days,buffet was setted at room temperature,full of flies.Beach very important to me and still can t figure out how people like it,its does compare to a lake beach in canada,more of a rough style beach sands not cleaned and floor of sea was slimy.Again internet in cuba is useless,do not buy time for net,you can retreive 1-2 emails in 1hr.I guess if you like roughing it ,its more for a camper ,lots of woods and mountains,beach resembles a camp ground.you are succlued area ,so workers come from the city ,if the bus driver calls in sick your stuck,taxi too will not come for 1hr drive unless you pay.i found excursions ,rentals and food offer by restos or locals are more expensive and not what you expect.

reviews.text: Just returned from another great two weeks at Sierra Mar. Forget the road the resort is worth the rough ride. Food which has always been good has gotten better, the place is being cleaned up painting and fixing. The elevators although not operational are being worked on. Sunshine every day with temps in the high 20s to 30s. Staff as usual friendly and cooperative cleaning staff busy every day mopping and sweeping. Aways seemed to be 8-12 Cubans staying there but were not any problem. Resort was far from full mainly returnees but some new who mostly were very satisfied (Always a complainer or two) sometimes only about a dozen around the pool. Adofo's retaurant is a great addition and well worth a vist. Make no mistake this is not a five star resort but it is a great 3+ resort and a great bank for your buck.
reviews.title: Just keeps getting better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been there for the past 5 years. The sand has still not come back under the water at the hotel's beach; best to walk about 100 yards on the public beach and go in there. Food continues to improve, staff are warm and friendly, most entertainment is good, but those poor dancers! The stage is now in a dangerous state - holes at the back, rotten floor that a tourist or dancer is going to fall through - - feel sorry for those dancers with years of training being subjected to such a dangerous situation.

reviews.text: I travelled with Holasun from Toronto and the service from the check in and flight with Canjet was excellent. The staff that early in the morning were cheerful and made you forget you were in a line. At the Santiago airport, a package with room keys, resort bracelet and registration card made for a no fuss checkin. The safe keys were available at reception for 2 CUC per day (about $2,cad per day). The road was in good condition for about an hour of the one hour and forty minute journey. Some new culverts and crossings have been built and the rough spots are a combination of sand, gravel and asphalt. The hurricane helped dig some of those ruts a little deeper but the bus drivers do their best to keep the ride as smooth as possible. Reminds me of a couple of northern Ontario roads..The road equipment that had been working on the roads were moved to safety when Sandy came and has been needed elsewhere at the moment.
reviews.title: Hidden away treasure away from it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is built into the side of bluff. Done in levels with level five being the lobby, restaurants, pool, bank, shops, the stage show and 2 bars. We stayed on level three which put us two staircases of 20 steps each to get to most of the activities for the day. Elevators servicing the rooms has been replaced and they were just completing the facings with tiles. The service elevator behind the stage was working but you still needed to go down one level of stairs to use.
reviews.title: Subject: Brisas Sierra Mar Location:Guama Province, Cuba, Caribbean Title: We are 4 Times Repeaters and we LOVE it..!!

reviews.text: Our room, 329 was an oceanview which gave us a great shaded view in the morning to enjoy our coffee and a breathtaking view of the sunset every evening. Rooms were a little dated but were clean and comfortable. Beds were firm and ask right away for extra pillows because they were a little slim.There is a 110 outlet under the tv, but I did have a european converter that was helpful in the bathroom. Lots of towels for us and a courtesy basket with soap, body wash, shampoo, tissue.Even a couple of toothbrushes with paste for us forgetful travellers.Water was always the right temp for a shower and shower was perfect. The tv in our room was an older style but other guests had flatscreen. For being away from home, one of the stations was CTV Toronto, so we could keep up to date if we wanted to. There is no fridge or coffeemaker in the room, but the lobby bar is open 24 hours a day Air worked well and didn't make a lot of noise..A beach towel voucher is provided and it is up to you to keep track as it will cost you 25CUC if you misplace it. There are interconnecting rooms available for that family needing more space.
reviews.title: WOULD NOT GO BACK

reviews.text: Restaurants had enough choices for even that fussy eater. We found the choices more varied at breakfast and lunch than supper for the buffet. There was a lunch counter at the bar that served hotdogs, hamburger, grilled cheese sandwiches, pizza and fries from 4pm until 1am. The eco restaurant at the beach was a secluded oasis with excellent burgers and salad. (bring your favorite salad dressing as there is very limited choice). The cuban restaurant was good and the mariposa was ok. There was always a good selection and everything was marked in english. If you were still in doubt, all the servers speak excellent english.
reviews.title: Expected more

reviews.text: Hola!!! Just returned on March 28th from our first visit to Sierra Mar but certainly not our last!! This place is a gem as far as location, scenery, friendly staff etc. We have been to Varadaro before which the local Cuban's refer to as the "Cancun" of Cuba...how true! This place is authentic Cuba thru and thru. Certainly not the white sandy beaches (who cares anyways) but the location and scenery certainly make up for it. The hotel is clean with nice comfortable rooms all with amazing views of the mountains and ocean (one of the best scenic views ever!) Great showers, A/C, satellite TV.
reviews.title: Overall great resort. Very secluded, expensive fo Santiago excursion.

reviews.text: Staff were very nice and very helpful. We really enjoyed the local Cuban music whether by the pool bar at happy hour or in the lobby during evening hours after dinner. Food was fine and no issues whatsoever with drinking water etc. An amazing place to chill out with a good book,while enjoying clean fresh air, clean ocean water and a sense of total peace and serenity.Totally safe to wander away from the resort....the local Cuban people were extremely friendly. Will definitely be back!!!!!!!! .
reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
